name: In Other Words II Quiz | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Timmy ______ a ______ in my skipping rope.
questions.explanation:
tied knot.

	TIED as used in this sentence means the action of making a KNOT in a length of rope (tied is the past tense of to tie).

questions.text: Mary wanted to ______ her ______  ______ of shoes to the party.
questions.explanation:
wear new pair.

	The word WEAR in this sentence means to put on your body. NEW means-recently acquired. The word PAIR means two of an item.

questions.text: I need to get some ______ powder ______ my cat.
questions.explanation:
flea for.

	In this sentence FLEA is a small insect. FOR means to be used on the cat.

questions.text: Dad had to ______ the broken car to the repair shop ______ that it could be fixed.
questions.explanation:
tow so.

	TOW in the sentence means to pull along. SO means to enable, as in to enable the car to be fixed.

questions.text: Anne ______ the pony would stop when she pulled on the ______.
questions.explanation:
knew reins.

	KNEW in this sentence means she was aware or understood. (The "k" in the word KNEW is silent.) REINS are the leather straps used to control the pony.

questions.text: Jacob could ______  ______ to open his birthday presents.
questions.explanation:
not wait.

	NOT means unable. WAIT means to delay an action.

questions.text: We went to _____ our toys from the shop ______ the bus stop.
questions.explanation:
buy by.

	BUY means to purchase. BY means close to.

know  their.

	KNOW means to be aware of. THEIR means belonging to a group of people.

questions.text: The farmer and his ______ gather ______ from the fields while the ______ shines.
questions.explanation:
son hay sun.

	SON means the male child of the farmer. HAY means dried grass. SUN means the sun in the sky.

questions.text: The ______ water came further up the side of the ______ as the _____ came in.
questions.explanation:
sea pier tide.

	SEA means ocean or large area of water. PIER in this sentence means a landing jetty for boats. TIDE is the rise and fall of sea level.
